content:
This PR is purely 100+ Stacks Project tags and docs. This is a collaboration work of many students at Peking University.

And thanks to the community for the implementation of the @[stacks] attribute!

A very common problem is that not all paragraphs in the Stacks Project are tagged. We often incorrectly recognized a result stated in the paragraph that follows a tagged theorem immediately as part of the tagged lemma.
And partially this is because we printed out Stacks Project on paper instead of using the webpage. :octopus:
Can we arrange the go-to-definition on a @[stacks] attribute goes to the stacks webpage??
What is needed for that? I guess some help from the VS Code extension. Note that Marc Huisinga doesn't read this channel.
